fields.description:
Umbrella task. Should probably be broken down into component tasks. See [functional spec|http://extranet.atlassian.com/display/HS/Studio+Licensing+final+spec]

    * addition of Application Access Manager
    * reloadable licensing
    * modification of Crowd connector to support group/application association
    * modify Studio theme to hide tabs when not allowed
    * update licensing & HAMS to support two license types with two user counts
    * updates to StudioAdministration UI (StudioAdministration.jspa)
    * creation of StudioUserBrowser, change existing links to new browser
    * addition of new group (collaborators)
    * modification of permission scheme 
    * update user counter service and email templates

fields.description:
Studio lets one associate a JIRA project with a Confluence space, using "project links" (EditProjectLinks.jspa in the JIRA project admin page).  The intention appears to be that one could associate any space with a project. For instance, I wish to link the "ACC" project with the "OSAccess" Confluence space.

This almost works. Eg. when I'm on page http://opensymphony.jira.com/browse/ACC, the "wiki" link is http://opensymphony.jira.com/wiki/display/OSAccess (correct).

However, when I'm in Confluence, the project drop-down's link is incorrect, pointing to "http://opensymphony.jira.com/wiki/display/ACC" instead of "http://opensymphony.jira.com/wiki/display/OSAccess":

!studio_dropdown_badlink.png!

fields.description:
Crowd 1.4.x introduced nested groups. The implementation appears to make many operations go from O(1) to O\(n), where n is the number of users. 

Continuing the analysis done on AOD-896, a BrowseProjects page showing 18 projects takes around 1900ms over HTTP:

\[1807ms] - /secure/project/ViewProjects.jspa
\[2222ms] - /secure/project/ViewProjects.jspa
\[1916ms] - /secure/project/ViewProjects.jspa 

The same data in Crowd 1.4.4 (note: the JIRA client *must* also be 1.4.4), we have a 20x improvement:

\[112ms] - /secure/project/ViewProjects.jspa
\[111ms] - /secure/project/ViewProjects.jspa

Viewing an issue, Crowd 1.4.1.1 takes about 600ms:

\[900ms] - /browse/XW-647
\[361ms] - /browse/XW-647
\[605ms] - /browse/XW-647
\[670ms] - /browse/XW-647

Upgrading to 1.4.4 takes us down to 200ms:

\[248ms] - /browse/XW-647
\[214ms] - /browse/XW-647
\[188ms] - /browse/XW-647
fields.summary: Upgrade to Crowd 1.4.4 to improve performance

fields.description:
JIRA's Crowd connector is currently configured to use HTTPS, eg:

crowd.server.url=https://test.jira.com/crowd/services/

Since this is a local request, there is no need for the encryption. If we change it to http, then page request times decrease by 2-3x.. Eg the ViewProjects page for a Studio instance with 18 projects:

|| Seq || With https || With http ||
| 1 | \[6182ms] - /secure/project/ViewProjects.jspa | |
| 2 | \[6162ms] - /secure/project/ViewProjects.jspa | |
| 3 | \[6637ms] - /secure/project/ViewProjects.jspa | |
| 4 | | \[1807ms] - /secure/project/ViewProjects.jspa |
| 5 | | \[2222ms] - /secure/project/ViewProjects.jspa |
| 6 | | \[1916ms] - /secure/project/ViewProjects.jspa |
| 7 | \[6139ms] - /secure/project/ViewProjects.jspa | |
| 8 | \[6652ms] - /secure/project/ViewProjects.jspa | |

Watching the HTTP logs, there are 100 SOAP HTTP requests made to render this one page.

On test.jira.com with 56 projects:

|| Seq || With https || With http ||
| 1 | \[11048ms] - /secure/project/ViewProjects.jspa | |
| 2 | \[10851ms] - /secure/project/ViewProjects.jspa | |
| 3 | | \[4059ms] - /secure/project/ViewProjects.jspa |

Viewing an issue on test.jira.com:

|| Seq || With https || With http ||
| 1 | | \[584ms] - /browse/ZERO-1 |
| 2 | | \[524ms] - /browse/ZERO-1 |
| 3 | \[996ms] - /browse/ZERO-1 | |
| 4 | \[925ms] - /browse/ZERO-1 | |
fields.summary: Studio Crowd requests don't need to go over SSL

fields.description:
Currently if people want a customized Studio logo, they have to provide a URL to one, presumably on their site. This is bad because a) some people don't have their desired logo externally accessible, b) mixing HTTPS web content from two URLs will cause browsers to complain.  We need to provide a facility for users to upload the logo of their choice.

We can't just let Apache serve the image from a local directory, because the image has to be served with the same scheme (http or https) as the main page. Otherwise users will get IE's "This page contains both secure and nonsecure items" error.
fields.summary: Allow Studio logo to be uploaded

Showing 0 of 0 results

Wiki
Showing 0 of 0 results

Source
Showing 0 of 0 results

Reviews
Showing 0 of 0 results
{noformat}

fields.summary: Applinks problem causes Crucible activity stream to break

fields.description: A connector that will allow us to hook up external Crowds to Studio without removing the internal Crowd. allow one-way sync of auth info from external crowd. does not allow customers to bypass sysadmin permissions etc.
fields.summary: Crowd to Crowd connector

fields.description: New version available - Gliffy 1.4.
fields.summary: Upgrade version of Gliffy

fields.description: 8 hour spike. Modifications to Crowd connector. Can we use Crowd roles? Group attributes? Talk to MK and Don.
fields.summary: Spike/spec product updates to support updated licensing

fields.description: Timebox at 4 hours. Navbar css is in two files - how hard would it be to have the JIRA look & feel settings write to that file and elegantly update the navbar colors?
fields.summary: Spike/spec look&feel update by customers

fields.description: Revise the JIRA Studio Quick Start Guide to account for changes since the first copy, e.g. UI changes.
fields.summary: Revise JIRA Studio Quick Start Guide

fields.description:
Of the "Commit" permission, our page says:
{quote}These groups have the ability to browse, modify and commit code.{quote}

!svnperms.png!

But this does not reflect actual behaviour. If the "users" group is removed from "Read", nobody can read or commit to Subversion.
fields.summary: Developers unable to access SVN when 'users' group does not have Read access

fields.description:
Potentially add a new page to Admin section. See Michael's email for screenshots.

Update this page to reference new page for adding users:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=144212269
fields.summary: Improve documentation on how to add more users in JIRA Studio

fields.description:
Some Studio hosts have duplicate (typically 2, but test.jira.com has 5) licenseFileMonitor services, all scheduled to run every 10 minutes:

| licenseFileMonitor | com.atlassian.sal.jira.scheduling.JiraPluginScheduler$JiraPluginSchedulerService | 	10 	|
| licenseFileMonitor | com.atlassian.sal.jira.scheduling.JiraPluginScheduler$JiraPluginSchedulerService | 	10 |
fields.summary: Duplicate licenseFileMonitor services

fields.description: There are a handful of JIRA settings that need to be made in the WEB-INF/classes/jira-application.properties file. For instance, setting the date picker format and setting project key format. We need a way of persisting jira-application.properties across upgrades. This needs to be done on a per-customer basis rather than at build time.
fields.summary: Persist jira-application.properties across upgrades

fields.description: We should add stripquotes=true to the email processing services, so the "> quoted bits" aren't included.
fields.summary: Replies by email should have quoted section stripped

fields.description:
12 of the 36 Studio hosts have duplicate user counter services:

| User Counter Service  | com.atlassian.hosted.usercounter.UserCounterService 	 |	1440 |
| User Counter Service | com.atlassian.hosted.usercounter.UserCounterService  | 	720 	|
fields.summary: Duplicate user counter services

fields.description: I've sync'ed applinks for JIRA to Wiki and Wiki page edits and comments are still not showing up in global stream. Why?
fields.summary: Stream not displaying items from wiki

fields.description: FishEye license is not being applied when new license is reloaded
fields.summary: FishEye license is not being applied when new license is reloaded

fields.description: Example, browsing All Projects or or any of the application dashboards after being in a project, the project name is still displayed in the projects dropdown, instead of the default 'Projects' that is displayed when you fist log in. When you then click on WIki, for example, even though the project name is displayed in the drop-down, it may or may not take you into the specific project or to the Conf dashboard, depending on where you are coming from (global dashboard -> wiki with project selected takes you to specific project, all projects -> wiki with project selected takes you to Conf dashboard.) If you're not in a specific project, the drop-down should always just display 'Projects'
fields.summary: Project drop-down shouldn't display project name if not in a project

fields.description: As seen in https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JST-206, if a user gets changed, or one gets added & deleted, FE contains the list of all users who've ever existed, making it artificially go over the user count. One way or another, we need to make sure that customers do not incorrectly get dinged for going over user count when they actually aren't (whether that means fixing the Crowd user matching or changing the number of users we put in the FE license or something else).
fields.summary: FishEye user count doesn't necesarily reflect Crowd user count

fields.description:
Allow look & feel of navbar to be customized by customers

Ticket created for tracking this customer feature request.
fields.summary: Allow look & feel of navbar to be customized by customers (remaining task - improve caching)

fields.description: *  Commit message containing this link to a Confluence page causes trouble According to \[this|Woozies are blue\] they are blue...: ** Link renders as \[this|Woozies are blue\] in Fisheye where the whole thing links to 'http://test.jira.com/wiki/display/WOOZ/this<pipe>Woozies%20are%20blue' ** In the Source tab the link renders fine with 'this' being linked to the confluence page We should either fix up fisheye or at least have the two behaving consistently. This will be hard to fix... ** The Activity Stream doesn't use any wiki rendering at all
fields.summary: Wiki Rendering in commit messages

fields.description:
A slight UI hiccup with Crucible review - orange box overlapped the "Reopen" button.

!http://extranet.atlassian.com/download/attachments/1641349187/_CR_ui.png!
fields.summary: UI - Box overlaps menu

fields.description: Recent project drop down menu should not remove project name from main list when project is included recent project section.
fields.summary: Recent project drop down menu should not remove project name from main list

fields.description: When a new project is created, that project should automagically be selected in the project dropdown right away.
fields.summary: Project dropdown inclusion for newly created project

fields.description: Project dropdown in Fisheye & Crucible doesn't show the 'More...' link at the bottom if there are more than 20 projects.
fields.summary: Project dropdown in Fisheye & Crucible doesn't show the 'More...' link at the bottom
